alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Blackfoot Mountains; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:37PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...AREA OF THUNDERSTORMS WORKING SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE CENTRAL DESERT TOWARD SHELLEY, POCATELLO, AND MINIDOKA THROUGH 730 PM MDT... At 628 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a discontinuous line of thunderstorms extending from 9 miles southeast of Southeast Inl to 10 miles northwest of Springfield to 19 miles northwest of Minidoka. These storms were generally moving southeast at 25 mph with an accompanying outflow boundary extending out in front of the line. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 35 to 45 mph have been observed along this line and could reach as high as 50 mph out ahead of collapsing thunderstorm cells. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds may create difficult driving conditions along Interstate 15 and 84 through 730 PM and hazardous boating conditions across American Falls Reservoir and Lake Walcott. Those individuals attending the Pocatello Wellness Center outdoor concert should be prepare for potentially hazardous weather conditions impacting the venue as early as 730 PM and lasting 20 to 40 minutes in length. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, know where to go if you need to seek shelter.
